div.div: Client discovers the secret-manager automatically and per convention

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 338px; height: 1px; padding-top: 485px; margin-left: 32px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.font:
The
JWT of the SA
is mounted into the FS of the pod as volume. The minimum TTL is 10min. Notice the custom audience for the secret-manager. This prevents misuse of this token.

font.span: This FS cannot be read from anybody (no shell). Therefore, we are allowed to use a long-lived token (<1y or EOF of pod)

switch.text: The JWT of the SA is mounted into the FS of the pod as v...

div.div:
The client-lib used in the service reads the SA-JWT from the FS and sends it as the Auth-header to the
Secret-Manager
.
The Secret-Manager then validates the JWT and checks if the service has access.

switch.text: The client-lib used in the service reads the SA-JWT from...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
